703707f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Orange Street
703707f-a.text:
Columbia Heights, north from Orange to Fulton Streets; showing a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge in the background. (The tall building in the
center is the Hotel Margaret).
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703707f-a.folder: Columbia Heights & Orange Street, Brooklyn, NY

703713f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Orange Street
703713f-a.text:
Columbia Heights, west side, south frow Orange Street.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703713f-a.folder: Columbia Heights & Orange Street, Brooklyn, NY

703714f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Orange Street
703714f-a.text:
106-112 Columbia Heights, west side, north of Orange Street, sho ing the center house (No. 110) in which Col. Washington A. Roebling lived. It was from the rear room on the second floor that he watched and directed the construction of the Brooklyn Bridge, being ably assisted in this work by
his wife.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703714f-a.folder: Columbia Heights & Orange Street, Brooklyn, NY
